intro: Hieracium arvicola subsp. erythrochristum, commonly known as the red-christed hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit. The plant produces yellow flowers with a distinctive red-pink center, which becomes more prominent as the blooms mature. It thrives in alpine and subalpine environments, often growing in rocky or gravelly soils. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
